message.content:
{"id": "3666", 
 "title": "Bug 3666 - CodeCompletion Hungry code assist", 
 "description": "Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature eats too much code. Consider the enclosed class. As a programmer, I must add a parameter to the `baz` call in `bar` to make the program correct. Steps to reproduce the issue: 1. Place the cursor after the first `x.` in the `baz` call. 2. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist. 3. Type `f` to filter the list. 4. Select `foo()`. The code is changed to: `baz(x.x.foo())`. I would expect the code assist to give me `baz(x.foo()x.foo())`.", 
 "OB": "The code assist feature should give the expected result by providing `baz(x.foo()x.foo())` instead of `baz(x.x.foo())`.", 
 "EB": "The code assist feature currently gives `baz(x.x.foo())`. It should be changed to `baz(x.foo()x.foo())`.", 
 "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 1. Change the baz call to `baz(x.x.foo())`. 2. Place the cursor after the first `x.` in the `baz` call. 3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist. 4. Type `f` to filter the list. 5. Select `foo()`."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '3666', 'title': 'Bug 3666CodeCompletion  Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)', 'description': 'Bug 3666CodeCompletionHungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)jresdk 106Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.Consider the enclosed class.As a programmer, I must add aparameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.Steps:1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the codeassist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to controlthe amount of source to replace. Removing codeassist option. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'The code is changed to:baz(x.foo().foo())I would rather it gave mebaz(x.foo()x.foo())public class X {void bar(X x) {baz(x.foo());}int foo() {return 5;}void baz(int i, int j) {}}KUM (5/21/01 9:02:11 AM)The text to replace is computed by the code assist infrastructure.Moved to ITPJCORE.PM (9/4/2001 2:58:56 PM)Option was added.PM (9/25/2001 2:20:50 PM)Removing option. The choice amongst one or the other should be conditioned by a keystroke (enter=replace until end, insert=replace until cursor location).Moving to ITPJUI. ', 'SR': 'Change the baz call tobaz(x.x.foo())2. Place the cursor after the first "x."3. CtrlSpace to bring up code assist4. Type "f" to filter the list.5. Select, "foo()"6. '}
